titlepage.subtitle: Finding Aid

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Women's clubs collection
did.abstract: Collection of files on women's clubs in the United States, primarily in New England.

daodesc.p: Six members of the Birdwoman Club, an organization for women pilots and students, undated

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of small files on various women's clubs in the United States, primarily in New England. The collection dates from 1812 to the present and includes charitable, literary, political, social and religious clubs. Some of those represented are the Concord Female Charitable Society (1812-1912), Mother's Study Club (Cambridge), the Home Study Club (Ashland, Mass.), Woman's National Democratic Club (Washington, DC), Worcester Woman's Club, and the Woman's Baptist Social Union (Boston). There is also a small amount of material on African American club women Josephine St. Pierre Ruffin (Women's ERA Club of Boston) and Julia Davis (Saint Louis City Association of Colored Women's Clubs). Types of materials include programs, yearbooks, calendars, by-laws, fliers, newsletters, histories, articles, books, pamphlets, and other published materials. There are also books, articles and pamphlets on the history of women's club movement, individual clubs and clubwomen. These include The Mother of Clubs: Caroline M. Seymour Severance, ed. Ella Giles Ruddy; and Reminiscences of the Springfield Women's Club, 1884-1924, by Carrie Niles Whitcomb.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection.

userestrict.p: Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Women's Clubs Collection, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected and may not be reflected in this record.

acqinfo.p: Items in this collection were either purchased or given to the Sophia Smith Collection by various donors. New materials are acquired and added to the collection from time to time.

processinfo.p: Finding aid revised by Jennifer Smar, intern, 2005.
